result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany T Peters

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Brittany T Peters appeared by video, in custody from WI resource center.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Brittany T Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense asks for a further proceeding in 2-3 weeks to speak further with client. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:40 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Brittany T Peters. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense advises that the Defendant is in a supervised living facility in Winnebago, but has been unable to make contact with the Defendant. Defense has sent letter to the Defendant and has received no response from her. Defense does not have a pre-trial offer. 
State forwards pre-trial offer. 

Court will set another hearing and Clerk will attempt to set an appearance via video appearance.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:46 PM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   Defendant Brittany T Peters did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was unable to appear as she is currently at a treatment facility via TCI. 

Atty Klein states she has not had any contact with the Defendant. Court will set a status in mid-September.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
